meanings.definition: A large, heavy scale used for weighing heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The superscales at the market can weigh even the heaviest fruits.
meanings.sent2: The movers used superscales to weigh the massive furniture.
meanings.sent3: The superscales groaned under the weight of the huge watermelon.
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking grew on a superscale, measuring each ingredient meticulously.
meanings.sent5: The superscales in the warehouse were as big as a small car.

meanings.definition: A series of scales that are larger or more extensive than usual.
meanings.sent1: The superscales in the gym offer a wide range of weight options.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's superscales allowed for precise measurements in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The superscales in the kitchen made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The superscales of justice tipped in favor of the defendant.
meanings.sent5: The superscales of the dragon shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To increase the size or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to superscales her garden by adding more flower beds.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to superscales its production to meet the growing demand.
meanings.sent3: His appetite seemed to superscales every time he visited the buffet.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity superscales when working on a large canvas.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline superscales as new skyscrapers are built.
